page.title: 18FARMING IN CHERINGTON
page.content: Our class carried out a survey of the farms in our area. Of 7 questionaires sent out, 5 replied. The total amount of land farmed in the sample is 2709 acres, the smallest being 7 acres and the largest holding 1150 acres. 2292 acres are used for crops, mainly barley (899 ac.) and wheat (882 ac.). Winter varieties, planted in the Autumn, predominate as they can be harvested earlier in the Summer. Oats and Rape are the only other crops grown. 397 acres are used for grazing animals. The largest farm has the most animals - 120 Hereford and Fresian cattle and 300 Scottish Halfbreed sheep. The remaining animals are 24 Jacob sheep, kept on the 7 acre smallholding.
